BlueIvoryCreative
2023-03-10T17:39:40-06:00
About Us
Our Mission
Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is dedicated to educating, entertaining, and inspiring our guests to respect and preserve wildlife by providing unique and memorable experiences for visitors of all ages to connect with marine life.
Our Team
Gulfarium employs dedicated and educated professionals across many different fields. Learn more about our incredible staff that is devoted to creating unforgettable guest experiences as well as top notch animal welfare.
Meet the Team
Our History
Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park has entertained millions since its inception in 1955. In the early 1950’s J.B. “Brandy” Siebenaler, a well-respected marine researcher and graduate of the University of Miami’s Marine Laboratory, had a vision to display marine life in a way that visitors to this area had never seen before. Brandy sold the developers of northwest Florida the idea that Fort Walton Beach needed an aquarium, a tourist attraction and scientific research center.
In early 1954, the Gulfarium was incorporated by fifteen scientists at the University of Miami and fifty local residents. Today, many of the stockholders at the Gulfarium are the same, or their heirs, as they were back then.
Learn More
Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park has entertained millions since its inception in 1955. In the early 1950’s J.B. “Brandy” Siebenaler, a well-respected marine researcher and graduate of the University of Miami’s Marine Laboratory, had a vision to display marine life in a way that visitors to this area had never seen before. Brandy sold the developers of northwest Florida the idea that Fort Walton Beach needed an aquarium, a tourist attraction, and scientific research center.
In early 1954, the Gulfarium was incorporated by fifteen scientists at the University of Miami and fifty local residents. Today, many of the stockholders at the Gulfarium are the same, or their heirs, as they were back then.
In September of 1954, construction began on a 600-foot stretch of Okaloosa Island in Fort Walton Beach, Florida. The main dolphin habitat took 11 months to develop and built entirely from battleship steel originally from Mississippi. In August of 1955, the Gulfarium opened its doors for the first time with admission prices at $1 for adults and $0.50 for children.
In the beginning, the main habitat contained multiple animal species including sharks, dolphins, rays, and sea turtles. This habitat doubled as both the dolphin show and the Living Sea exhibit with a daily shark feeding demonstration on SCUBA gear. Glass portholes at varying levels gave the visitor the impression of actually being in the sea with the marine life.
Despite knowing that their main attraction animals were actually called dolphins, the trainers referred to them as porpoises so not to confuse the public with the dolphin fish that they consumed. These “porpoises” were trained to jump high to ring dinner bells and collect fish from the trainers hand or even mouth.
In 1956, a separate Living Sea exhibit was built, providing another view “under the sea” with daily dive demonstrations led by Gulfarium staff. This was the first aquarium of its time to feature viewing windows that stretched from the sea floor to the water’s surface. While common now, this was groundbreaking at the time. Throughout the years, additional habitats and exhibits have been added including sea lions, seals, otters, alligators, and exotic birds.
The Gulfarium’s extensive history of shows and demonstrations continues to this day, with the recent addition of close-up animal encounters, providing our visitors with a new dimension of discovering sea life.
Celebrating 65 years of care
In 2020, Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park celebrated its 65th anniversary. As one of the world’s oldest marine animal parks, we are thrilled to celebrate many milestones including:
The first marine park to perform underwater shows on SCUBA gear, rather than the traditional full-helmet dive gear of the era.
The first to record a dolphin jumping to a height of 21 feet.
The first to successfully raise a stranded baby bottlenose dolphin.
The first to develop a synthetic milk formula for bottlenose dolphins. This formula is still used today.
These are among many of the significant impact the Gulfarium has had on the community as well as the field of marine animal care and training. If interested in more info, visit www.gulfariumbook.com.
Images of America: Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park
If you’ve enjoyed visiting the Gulfarium over the years, or even just once in a while, you’ll love this photographic journey of Gulfarium’s past and present. Filled with photos of historic dolphin shows, animal exhibits, and dive demonstrations, these images are sure to bring a smile to your face or even spur a memory of your own park visits. Autographed copies are available at
www.gulfariumbook.com.

Private Events
BlueIvoryCreative
2024-12-17T16:21:35-06:00
Private Events
Book An Unforgettable Private Event!
At the Gulfarium, we provide an exceptional venue for hosting private events in a variety of unique and captivating settings. Whether you’re planning a corporate gathering, family celebration, special occasion party, or a wedding, our facility offers an extraordinary backdrop that will leave a lasting impression on your guests. Located on the beautiful Emerald Coast, we ensure that every event is infused with the magic of marine life and stunning views, creating unforgettable memories for you and your attendees.
We host a wide range of events, including:
Weddings & Proposals
Dinners
Cocktail parties
Mixers
Birthdays
Promotion and retirement ceremonies
Family and class reunions
Corporate Functions
Banquets
Dances
Anniversaries
Holiday parties
And more!
Let us help you make your next event truly memorable!
Inquire Today
Discover Your Perfect Private Event Venue
Discover Your Perfect Private Event Venue
At the Gulfarium, we specialize in hosting private events that combine marine beauty with unique experiences, ensuring your gathering is truly unforgettable. Conveniently located on Okaloosa Island between Fort Walton Beach and Destin, our venue offers easy access for both you and your guests. With enchanting views from the Living Sea Room, picturesque outdoor settings at Seal Harbor, and the breathtaking Dolphin Oasis, each location serves as the perfect backdrop for corporate gatherings, family celebrations, cocktail parties, or special occasion parties. Explore our diverse venue options to discover the ideal space for your next memorable event!
Living Sea Aquarium
The Living Sea Room immerses guests in vibrant aquarium views, creating a breathtaking backdrop for your special event. This enchanting indoor venue ensures an unforgettable experience surrounded by marine life.
Seal Harbor Beachfront
Seal Harbor provides a picturesque outdoor setting for any occasion, featuring stunning views of the Gulf of Mexico. Exchange vows in a tranquil atmosphere that captures the essence of coastal romance.
Dolphin Oasis
Dolphin Oasis combines lush sandy dunes and sparkling waters, offering a unique backdrop for your celebration. With playful dolphins enhancing the experience, your event becomes an extraordinary adventure in a stunning coastal paradise.
See All Our Event Spaces
Cocktail Functions
Cocktail Functions
Host an unforgettable cocktail function with us, where stunning marine backdrops and unique experiences create the perfect setting for your event! With a minimum of 15 guests, our venue offers a variety of spaces to suit your needs, complete with tables, bar attendants, and all necessary supplies. Enjoy exclusive access to our beautiful surroundings while your guests mingle and celebrate against the enchanting backdrop of our marine life. Explore our various locations below to find the ideal spot for your cocktail gathering!
Living Sea
Price starting at
$650
The Living Sea Aquarium Room offers a captivating indoor setting with breathtaking views of vibrant aquariums that will mesmerize your guests. This spacious venue, featuring a full wall of 8-foot-high aquarium windows, is perfect for intimate gatherings or larger cocktail functions, accommodating up to 220 guests. With audio/visual capabilities and an integrated sound system, it provides an ideal atmosphere for presentations or dancing, making your event truly memorable.
Dolphin Oasis
Price starting at
$1,000
Experience the beauty of the Dolphin Oasis, our stunning outdoor space surrounded by sandy dunes and lush palms, with picturesque views of the dolphins. This beach-themed venue can host up to 400 guests, offering a relaxed yet elegant atmosphere for your cocktail function. Enjoy the natural surroundings while creating lasting memories with your guests as they take in the sights and sounds of the Gulf Coast.
Park Wide
Price starting at
$1,500
The Park Wide option provides a unique combination of indoor and outdoor spaces, allowing you to create an event that spans the entirety of the Gulfarium. With breathtaking animal exhibits and beach front views, this versatile location can accommodate up to 600 guests. It’s the perfect choice for those looking to host a grand cocktail function, offering a dynamic environment where guests can explore and celebrate amid the wonders of marine life.
Request Custom Event Pricing
Baby Showers & Gender Reveals
Baby Showers & Gender Reveals
Looking to make your baby shower or gender reveal stand out? Host it “under the sea” and customize it with our animal add-on options. With multiple décor and theming options, you can create a custom event that will get people talking.

How to Get Here
Find directions to our stunning venue, conveniently located between Fort Walton Beach and Destin with easy access to Okaloosa Island’s amenities. Your journey starts here.
Events Questions
How can I book a private event at the Gulfarium?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:48:02-05:00
How can I book a private event at the Gulfarium?
To book a private event or inquire about availability, please contact our dedicated events team. They will guide you through the booking process and assist you with any questions or concerns you may have.
Is the Gulfarium accessible for guests with disabilities?
BlueIvoryCreative
2023-09-28T11:14:12-05:00
Is the Gulfarium accessible for guests with disabilities?
Yes, we are committed to providing a welcoming and accessible environment for all guests. Our facility is designed to accommodate individuals with disabilities, including accessible entrances, restrooms, and parking.
Can I bring my own vendors for my private event?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:58:45-05:00
Can I bring my own vendors for my private event?
We have a list of preferred vendors, but we are open to working with outside vendors as long as they meet our requirements and guidelines. Our team can provide you with more information regarding vendor arrangements.
Is there parking available for private event guests?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:59:23-05:00
Is there parking available for private event guests?
Yes, the Gulfarium provides ample free parking for event guests. Our team will provide information on parking arrangements and any additional assistance needed.
Can I have catering services for my private event at Gulfarium?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:59:59-05:00
Can I have catering services for my private event at Gulfarium?
The Gulfarium does not provide catering, but can recommend a list of vendors to help you in the event planning process.
Can I customize my private event package?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T10:01:40-05:00
Can I customize my private event package?
Absolutely! We offer customizable event packages to suit your preferences, budget, and specific requirements. Our event coordinators will work closely with you to design a package that meets your needs and brings your vision to life.

Events Questions
How can I book a private event at the Gulfarium?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:48:02-05:00
How can I book a private event at the Gulfarium?
To book a private event or inquire about availability, please contact our dedicated events team. They will guide you through the booking process and assist you with any questions or concerns you may have.
Is the Gulfarium accessible for guests with disabilities?
BlueIvoryCreative
2023-09-28T11:14:12-05:00
Is the Gulfarium accessible for guests with disabilities?
Yes, we are committed to providing a welcoming and accessible environment for all guests. Our facility is designed to accommodate individuals with disabilities, including accessible entrances, restrooms, and parking.
Can I bring my own vendors for my private event?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:58:45-05:00
Can I bring my own vendors for my private event?
We have a list of preferred vendors, but we are open to working with outside vendors as long as they meet our requirements and guidelines. Our team can provide you with more information regarding vendor arrangements.
Is there parking available for private event guests?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:59:23-05:00
Is there parking available for private event guests?
Yes, the Gulfarium provides ample free parking for event guests. Our team will provide information on parking arrangements and any additional assistance needed.
Can I have catering services for my private event at Gulfarium?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T09:59:59-05:00
Can I have catering services for my private event at Gulfarium?
The Gulfarium does not provide catering, but can recommend a list of vendors to help you in the event planning process.
Can I customize my private event package?
BlueIvoryCreative
2025-04-29T10:01:40-05:00
Can I customize my private event package?
Absolutely! We offer customizable event packages to suit your preferences, budget, and specific requirements. Our event coordinators will work closely with you to design a package that meets your needs and brings your vision to life.

Event Additional Services
We can handle the details, so you can focus on the fun!
We can handle the details, so you can focus on the fun!
At the Gulfarium, we enhance your special events with a range of additional services that ensure a seamless and unforgettable experience. As a premier event venue in Fort Walton Beach and Destin, we offer unique options such as animal encounters, day-of coordination, and exclusive private park time. Whether you’re planning a wedding, corporate meeting, or special celebration, our dedicated team is here to help you create an extraordinary event that reflects your vision and leaves a lasting impression on your guests.
Additional Services:
Animal Add-Ons
Private Shows
Animal Meet & Greet
Dolphin, Sea Lion, and Penguin photo options available
Day-Of Coordinator
Decoration & Linen Rental
Bar Attendants
Beverage Packages
Cake Cutting
Decoration Team
Food & Beverage Related Services
End of Night Takedown & Packout
And More…
Inquire About Your Event
Animal Add-Ons
Customize your event at the Gulfarium, conveniently located on Okaloosa Island, with our exciting animal add-ons for a one-of-a-kind experience! Choose from thrilling dolphin and sea lion shows, unforgettable photo sessions with our marine friends, and even a penguin ring bearer to delight your guests. All animal add-ons must be booked at least one month prior to your scheduled event date, so secure these memorable opportunities for your special occasion!
Private Presentations
Dolphin Show
: Enjoy a marvelous display of talent and agility as our Atlantic bottlenose dolphins leap, splash, and play! Duration: 10-12 minutes. (Available mid-March to mid-October, with the last available show time at 5:30pm.)
Sea Lion Show
: Clown around with our California sea lions! Duration: 10-12 minutes. Price includes 30 minutes of park time before or after Sea Lion Show (or 15 min on either side). (Available mid-March to mid-October, with the last available show at 5:30pm.)
Photo Opportunities
Photos with a Dolphin
: Pose alongside your new flippered friends as your photographer captures the memories! (Available mid-March to mid-October Friday Monday, with the last available photoshoot time at 5:30pm)
Dock Side Photo Session
: Get up-close and personal with one of our Atlantic Bottlenose Dolphins. Only 4 people, along with a photographer will be allowed on the dock.
Group Shot
: Strike a pose in front of our acrylic viewing window with some of your friends/family. Includes 3 poses with dolphins jumping in the background. Unlimited number of people.
Snap Shot
: Capture an iconic moment during your event at Oasis with dolphins jumping on cue. (moment will be pre-selected)
Photos with a Sea Lion for up to 4 people
: Pose alongside your new spunky friend as your photographer captures the memories! Includes: two or more behaviors/poses with the sea lion. Only the 4 people along with a photographer will be allowed with the sea lion. (Available mid-March to mid-October, with the last available photoshoot time at 6pm.)
Photos with a Penguin for up to 4 people
: Pose alongside a feathered friend as your photographer captures the memories! Includes: 10 minutes with a penguin. (Available year-round)
Animal Meet & Greet
Animal Meet & Greet
: See some of Gulfarium’s smaller animals up close during an informal presentation with a variety of rugged reptiles and cute critters! Animal variety is based on the discretion of staff and will not be determined in advance. (Available year-round)
Penguin Ring Bearer
Penguin Ring Bearer
: Surprise your partner and/or your guests with this unique experience. One of our trainers will act as “Ring Security” while escorting one of our penguins down the aisle with your rings. If you have a child already assigned as your ring bearer, they may walk alongside our trainer down the aisle. (Available year-round for both indoor and outdoor ceremonies)
Living Sea Diver
Living Sea Diver
: Amaze your guests with a surprise visit from one of our divers in the Living Sea Aquarium. They will be holding a custom sign (i.e. happy birthday, congratulations, wedding date, gender reveal, company logo, etc.) – sign included. (Available year-round)
Request Custom Event Pricing
*Currently booking through 2026
Day-Of Coordination
Our day-of event coordination services at the Gulfarium ensure that your special day runs smoothly and seamlessly along Florida’s beautiful Emerald Coast, allowing you to focus on enjoying every moment. With our experienced coordinators handling all the details, you can relax knowing that everything from setup to timing is expertly managed. Let us bring your vision to life while you create lasting memories with your guests in our stunning marine setting!
Seas the Day
Day-Of Coordinator & Decoration Team – Ceremony ONLY
This package is perfect for someone who has all of the details planned out but wants to fully enjoy the ceremony. Sometimes it’s worth it to just sit back and Seas the Day!
“Seas the Day!” Coordination Package includes:
An Initial Consultation (1 hr) two weeks prior to event date:
Discussion of Ceremony Expectations
Vendor Information
Creation of Ceremony Timeline.
Coordinator will organize and direct the ceremony rehearsal:
Usually scheduled 1 day prior to event date (dependent on venue schedule)
Coordination and confirmation with vendors, booked by client, for delivery and setup times
Timekeeper: making sure everyone is in the correct spot at the correct time
Queuing of bridal party / VIPs
Responsible for Setup and breakdown:
Tables and chairs
Personal ceremony décor
Store personal décor for client 1 day prior to event
BONUS: Use of “Event Day Emergency Kit”
Additional services must be booked and paid-in-full at least 2 weeks prior to event date. Full refund, minus deposit, is available until 30 days prior to event, at which time, if booked, all services are nonrefundable.
Make a Splash
Day-Of Coordinator – Reception Only
Want to make a big splash at your party or rehearsal dinner without the weight and pressure of the night? Then this package is for you. The “Make A Splash!” Coordination Package Includes:
Consultation:
A coordinator at your disposal beginning one-month prior to your event date
2 in-person or phone planning meetings which will incorporate: the turn-over of event information (i.e. color palettes, idea boards, layout ideas, etc.) and discussion of event day expectations.
Layout:
Custom reception layouts to meet specifics of the event.
Timeline:
Comprehensive event itinerary – sent to all vendors, party members and VIP guests.
Q&A:
Be available for any questions from vendors, guests, clients, etc.
Day-Of: Present the entirety of the event
Decorations & Linens:
Use of all Gulfarium decorations (i.e. centerpieces, arch, signs, etc.).
The Dream Team will setup all decorations as well as take them down.
Custom linen package included.
On-site Event Management:
Oversee the event site setup.
Make sure that the event is decorated according to what was previously discussed/ requested.
Timekeeper:
Keep the event on time and maintain the timeline
Problem Fixer:
Take care of any problems that arise during the event and work to fix them to the best of our ability.
BONUS: Use of “Event Day Emergency Kit
Additional services must be booked and paid-in-full at least 2 weeks prior to event date. Full refund, minus deposit, is available until 30 days prior to event, at which time, if booked, all services are nonrefundable.
Diving In
Day-Of Coordinator – Ceremony & Reception
Want to fully Dive Into what the day holds without the responsibility and distractions of the event? Then this package is for you. The “Diving In!” Coordination Package Includes:
Consultation:
A coordinator at your disposal beginning one-month prior to your event date
2 in-person or phone planning meetings which will incorporate: The turn-over of event information (i.e. color palettes, invoices, contracts, layout ideas, etc.) & discussion of wedding day expectations.
Layout:
Custom ceremony and reception layouts to meet specifics of event
Decorations:
Our Coordinator will make sure that the event is decorated according to what was previously discussed/requested – Decorations provided by client (Additional cost for elaborate décor)
Store personal décor for client 1 day prior to event
Additional cost for breakdown and packaging of personal décor ($200) – Waived if décor is being donated to Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park
Wedding Rehearsal Coordination:
Up to one hour of ceremony rehearsal organization and direction, upon request.
Timelines:
Comprehensive Day-Of Itinerary – Sent to all vendors, wedding party members and VIP guests
Q & A:
Be available for any questions from vendors, guests, clients, etc
Day-Of: Present the entirety of the event
On-Site Event Management:
Oversee the event site setup
Make sure that the event is decorated according to what was previously discussed/requested
Problem Fixer:
Take care of any problems that arise during and work to fix them to the best of our ability
Timekeeper:
Keep the event on time and maintain the timeline
BONUS: Use of “Event Day Emergency Kit”
Additional services must be booked and paid-in-full at least 2 weeks prior to event date. Full refund, minus deposit, is available until 30 days prior to event, at which time, if booked, all services are nonrefundable.
It's a Shore Thing
Day-Of Coordinator – Ceremony and/or Reception
“Its A Shore Thing” is the perfect package for anyone who is wanting all details of their event to be taken care of… from decorations and linens to timelines and bussing of tables. This package includes everything that is in our “Diving In!” package PLUS the following…
Consultation:
A coordinator at your disposal beginning two-months prior to your event date
3 in-person or phone planning meetings which will incorporate: Design consultation – provide stylist input on suggestions for wedding décor, favors, gifts, and welcome bags based on the overall wedding desired theme.
Decorations & Linens:
Use of all Gulfarium decorations (i.e. Centerpieces, aisle markers, signs, etc.)
The Dream Team will setup all decorations as well as take them down
Custom linen package included.
Vendor Liaison
Beginning the week of the event, confirm & communicate with all vendors booked by client – Caterers, food managers, DJs, decorators, MC, photographer, etc.
Ensure time of arrival and/or deliveries, as well as setup location
Timekeeper:
Cue guest(s) of honor & family for special moments including cake cutting, speeches, toasts & dancing
Day-Of: Present the entirety of the event
Additional Services (choose up to four):
Chafing Warmers & Dish Sets with Placement:
Chafing dish wire racks, disposable metal pans and 6hr heating elements
Plates – Heavy duty white plastic with silver trim: 1 dinner plate (10.25in) & 1 dessert/appetizer plate (7.5in) per guest.
Silver plastic utensils – 1 fork, 1 spoon, & 1 knife per guest.
Upcharge for biodegradable plates and utensils.
Food Attendant / Full Food Service Staffing:
Setup of food delivered by caterer
Restock/refresh throughout the night
Servers for food line (serving utensils provided by Gulfarium)
Bussing service for tables
Pack up of leftovers (to-go containers provided by Gulfarium)
Bar Attendant (1-2 depending on size of event):
Staffing to pour drinks throughout the reception time
Cake Cutting & Plating:
Provided: 6.25” clear plastic dessert plates and plastic forks
Champagne Toast
Champagne poured by the glass
Platic champagne flutes provided
End of Night Takedown & Packout:
Gathering of all personal décor, gifts & cards, food and placed in the lobby
Cards will be counted and placed into a sealed envelope to ensure that they are taken care of
BONUS: Use of “Event Day Emergency Kit
Additional services must be booked and paid-in-full at least 2 weeks prior to event date. Full refund, minus deposit, is available until 30 days prior to event, at which time, if booked, all services are nonrefundable.

C.A.R.E Center Is Awarded Funding For Medical Equipment
BlueIvoryCreative
2023-06-08T12:22:17-05:00
October 4, 2021
|
Featured News
|
The Gulfarium C.A.R.E. Center has been awarded a grant for $20,306.25 from the Florida Sea Turtle Grants Program. The C.A.R.E Center received the grant to help purchase a new digital radiograph (DR) x-ray machine. This new item will benefit sea turtles in NW Florida and Alabama. Since purchasing the DR x-ray plate the C.A.R.E. Center has already successfully completed radiographs on 31 rehabilitated sea turtles, ranging in size from juvenile green sea turtles to adult loggerheads. The DR machine enables the animal care technicians at the C.A.R.E. Center to view an x-ray image instantaneously after taking the photo. This process gives the animal care team real time information allowing for instant analysis.
The Gulfarium C.A.R.E. Center was chosen for the award through a competitive application process that is open to coastal county governments, educational institutions and Florida-based nonprofit groups striving to improve the livelihood of sea turtles and conserve Florida habitats.
Launched in 1996, the “Helping Sea Turtles Survive” specialty license plate raises money for two important programs that benefit Florida sea turtles – the Florida Wildlife Conservation Commission’s Marine Turtle Protection Program and the Sea Turtle Grants Program, which distributes money back to the local level for turtle conservation projects. The sea turtle specialty plate is currently number two in sales, having sold 66,696 plates in 2010 – second only to the University of Florida specialty plate.
“It’s rewarding to know that so many people share our concern for Florida’s sea turtles,” said David Godfrey, Sea Turtle Conservancy Executive Director. “What we do in this state has a dramatic impact on sea turtle populations around the world. By purchasing the sea turtle specialty plate, Floridians are voluntarily funding important programs to save these amazing creatures.” To learn more about the Sea Turtle Grants Program and the “Helping Sea Turtles Survive” specialty license plate, please visit www.helpingseaturtles.org.

Meet the Team
BlueIvoryCreative
2023-03-09T17:37:23-06:00
Meet the Team
Patrick Berry – Senior Vice President/COO
Patrick has worked with marine mammals as a trainer, husbandry coordinator, supervisor of training, curator, director of animal management and director of animal programs in the United States, the Bahamas, and French Polynesia (Tahiti) over the last 24 years.
More
His broad experiences in the field range from research with cetaceans including physiological studies which have been published, to husbandry, interactive training, open ocean training, film work in a variety of genre with dolphins, transport and handling, show presentation and lectures. He has worked and managed marine mammal facilities from the smallest of parks to most recently having been employed by one of the largest and most successful amusement park companies in the world. He and his family are enjoying being back near the ocean.
Stacy DiDonato – Education Coordinator
From 1998-2012 Stacy was actively involved in Gulfarium’s Animal Department as a marine mammal trainer and supervisor. She was honored when management appointed her as Education Coordinator, and she looks forward to creating innovative educational programming. She is a south Florida native and found her way to the Emerald Coast in 1995 where she resides with her husband and son.
Mary Kate Northup – Operations Manager
As a native to the Emerald Coast, Mary Kate remembers spending time enjoying the Gulfarium as a child. After spending several years in the animal care profession and graduating from the University of West Florida, she is excited to join the Gulfarium team and share her passion for conservation and the natural world.
Evan Gibson – Director of Facility Maintenance
A transplant from Oklahoma, Evan has been with Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park since 2006. He is a jack of all trades and his common reply to requests is, “That won’t be a problem.”
Jeff Fogle – Director of Animal Management
After getting his degree in Psychology at University of Central Florida, Jeff Fogle began his animal care profession in the sunny Florida Keys in 2005 with bottlenose dolphins. Over the course of his career, Jeff has worked in dynamic presentations, guest focused interactions, husbandry, and educating people on wildlife conservation. Jeff joined the Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park team in 2019 as the Director of Animal Management where he strives to provide excellent welfare and training to the resident animals.
Tabitha Siegfried – Sea Turtle Stranding Coordinator
Tabitha Siegfried has always loved marine life and the ocean, so after graduating from University of West Florida with a B.S. in Marine Biology, she went on to pursue her graduate degree specifically in sea turtle ecology. During her master’s, Tabitha worked on verifying a robust, non-invasive protocol to colleting sea turtle morphometrics. Tabitha has researched sea turtles in the Bahamas, Crystal River, and the Gulf of Mexico. She joined the Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park team in 2021 as the Sea Turtle Stranding Coordinator where she ensures the conservation of sea turtles, educates the public about sea turtle awareness, and implements her innovative research techniques.
